parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) gen: I obtain, (b) absol: I chance, happen; ordinary, everyday, it may chance, perhaps.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.
Offspring, family, race, nation, kind. From ginomai; 'kin'.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
Soundless, voiceless, speechless, dumb. Figuratively, unmeaning.
